title: Team that cooked, most frustrated fan bases and more: Passan's trade deadline awards
content: What we learned from the deals -- and titles for the teams with the most interesting elements of trade season.

title: Sources: QB Bridgewater to sign with Buccaneers
content: Veteran NFL QB Teddy Bridgewater is visiting Tampa on Tuesday and is expected to sign with the Bucs, sources told ESPN's Adam Schefter.

title: Sources: Banged-up Browns sign 5th QB in Huntley
content: The Browns are signing quarterback Tyler Huntley, sources said, adding depth with multiple passers nursing injuries.

title: Sources: Raiders trade CB Bennett to Eagles
content: The Raiders are trading cornerback Jakorian Bennett to the Eagles in exchange for defensive tackle Thomas Booker IV, sources told ESPN's Adam Schefter.

title: Sources: Packers' Hobbs (knee) out rest of camp
content: Packers cornerback Nate Hobbs is expected to miss the remainder of training camp after having arthroscopic knee surgery over the weekend, sources confirmed to ESPN, but could be back for the regular-season opener Sept. 7 against the Lions.

title: Judge's return on tap as Yanks plummet in East
content: Yankees slugger Aaron Judge will be activated from the injured list before Tuesday's game against the Rangers, manager Aaron Boone said after his team lost its fourth straight Monday.

title: Sources: LeBron congratulated Luka on new deal
content: LeBron James congratulated Luka Doncic on his new three-year, $165 million contract extension via a video call Saturday, sources confirmed to ESPN.

title: Guardians' Enright, fighting cancer, gets 1st save
content: Guardians reliever Nic Enright recorded his first career save on Monday night, more than three years after he was diagnosed with Hodgkin lymphoma.

title: Fan accused of sex toy toss faces multiple charges
content: The man arrested for allegedly throwing a sex toy onto the court during last week's Valkyries-Dream game faces charges of disorderly conduct, public indecency/indecent exposure and criminal trespass, according to law enforcement records.

title: 🛑Fantasy football: Do Not Draft list
content: The annual hit is back, with players Eric Karabell feels are going earlier than they should in fantasy football drafts.

title: Latest buzz from NFL training camp: What we heard at 16 teams' practices, plus fantasy intel
content: Our national reporters visited 16 NFL teams since training camps began, talking to players and coaches about what to expect this season.

title: The 40 most important players in college football this season
content: From QBs on sure-fire CFP contenders to potential stars looking to break through, these players will shape the 2025 season.

title: 'He never wanted to leave': How Damian Lillard's return to Portland began 18 months ago
content: After two seasons in Milwaukee, Damian Lillard returns to Portland with a torn Achilles and confidence in his future.

title: From another title in OKC to new plans in Phoenix, what is every team 'all-in' for in 2025-26?
content: Not everyone can be all-in for the title in 2025-26. See each franchise's priority No. 1 for the upcoming season.

title: Grading 50-plus NBA deals, including De'Aaron Fox, Spurs max extension
content: Kevin Pelton breaks down the most impactful signings, including the Clippers bringing back Chris Paul.

title: Saints QB1 or not, Tyler Shough believes 'this is going to work out'
content: Expectations are high for the second-round pick, but the 26-year-old knows adversity and he's not backing away.

title: Confidence, conditioning and catches: What we've learned about Travis Hunter so far
content: The Jaguars' dual receiver and cornerback has had an eventful two weeks in his first NFL training camp.

title: Power Rankings: Dream climb while Lynx, Liberty contend with star injuries
content: Atlanta rides a three-game winning streak up the board while Minnesota and New York navigate without their stars.

title: Trade grades: Wings cut ties with Carrington, look to future
content: The Lynx added DiJonai Carrington as contenders look upgrade their rosters before the Aug. 7 trade deadline.

title: Are high-priced foreign players really ready for the jump to the Premier League?
content: Digging into why the Premier League is so much more challenging for players than any other league in the world.

title: Can Barça's title defense endure summer of self sabotage?
content: It's been one misstep after another for Barcelona, but on the field they're so strong it may not matter.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Vlahovic offered to Man United amid Sesko pursuit
content: Juventus striker Dusan Vlahovic has been offered to Manchester United, in the event that a move for RB Leipzig's Benjamin Sesko falls through. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: NWSL Power Rankings: Current pick right up where they left off
content: The NWSL is back from its summer break, and the Kansas City Current haven't skipped a beat. That and more in ESPN's NWSL Power Rankings.

title: Way-Too-Early Top 25 rankings: Every team's most important nonconference game
content: Regional rivalries, freshmen debuts and more of the most intriguing nonconference game to tune into for each preseason top 25 team.

title: Why Luka Doncic left guaranteed money on the table to chase an even bigger future payday
content: The Luka Era in L.A. has officially begun. Here's what you need to know about Doncic's three-year, $165 million deal.

title: Pickups: Seven players seizing post-deadline opportunity
content: As the MLB season moves beyond the trade deadline, here are the players you should be claiming off the fantasy waiver wire.

title: Waiver wire: Look to Shepard, Carleton while Collier is out
content: Minnesota's Jessica Shepard and Bridget Carleton are worth adding from the waiver wire following the injury to Lynx star Napheesa Collier.

title: Betting buzz: Baldwin favorite as Misiorowski injury shakes up NL Rookie race
content: Drake Baldwin emerges as heavy NL Rookie of the Year favorite after Jacob Misiorowski's odds slide after injury.

title: Did Prograis, Duarte, Canizales do enough to enter the rankings?
content: The junior welterweight and junior flyweight division were in action this weekend. Here are the latest ESPN divisional rankings.

title: 'I am useless': Hamilton spiraling in dire Ferrari debut year
content: In February, Lewis Hamilton was full of smiles, eager to win a championship for Ferrari. Six months later, he sounds defeated.

title: South Carolina to Illinois: SportsCenter's 50-in-50 Week 6 quiz
content: From Florida to North Carolina, the "SportsCenter" 50 state tour continues. We're back for our penultimate quiz of the summer.

title: Raj Thackeray's Partymen Storm Nagpur Bank, Assault Employee
content: Workers o Raj Thackeray's Maharashtra Navnirman Sena created a ruckus at a bank in Nagpur, slapping a bank employee and blackening his face.

title: 7-Year-Old Girl Injured In Sudden Attack By Pitbull In Chennai: Police
content: A seven-year-old girl was injured after a Pitbull suddenly attacked her in Tondiarpet here, police said on Tuesday.

title: Google Earth Captures The Uttarakhand Flash Flood Devastation
content: At least four people have died and several are feared trapped under debris after a powerful cloudburst struck the Dharali area near Harsil in Uttarakhand's Uttarkashi district on Tuesday afternoon, triggering flash floods.

title: Putin Doubts Potency Of Trump's Ultimatums To End War With Ukraine: Report
content: The Russian leader does not want to anger Trump, and he realises that he may be spurning a chance to improve relations with Washington and the West, but his war goals take precedence, two of the sources said.

title: India Is Not A "Tariff King": US Claims vs Reality
content: US President Donald Trump has labelled India as the "Tariff King" and an "abuser" of trade duties, suggesting the country unfairly protects its markets through high customs duties.

title: Uttarakhand Cloudburst: NDRF, ITBP Teams Rush To Dharali
content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Tuesday spoke to Uttarakhand Chief Minister Pushkar Singh Dhami to take stock of the situation following a cloudburst in the Dharali region of Uttarkashi district, causing significant damage in the region.

title: Video: Raging River Swallows Homes In Uttarakhand Cloudburst Horror
content: People could be heard screaming as a massive cloudburst struck a village in Uttarakhand on Tuesday afternoon, flattening everything in its wake, shows a disturbing video that captured the horror.

title: Opinion: Opinion |  Now, The More Difficult Act: Rebuilding The Middle East
content: Physical reconstruction has to go hand in hand with socio-political institution-building. Inevitably, the legacy of the past hostilities has created bitterness and mutual suspicions, complicating the recovery.

title: 4 Dead, Scores Buried In Sludge: Cloudburst Horror In Uttarakhand Village
content: Horrifying visuals surfaced in which a strong stream of water can be seen flowing down from a hill towards the Dharali village in Uttarkashi, causing huge destruction.

title: Uttarkashi Cloudburst Updates: Cloudburst Leads To Flash Floods, Many People Missing
content: Uttarkashi Flash Floods Updates: Horrifying visuals of the incident showed a strong stream of water flowing down from a hill towards the Tharali village, sweeping away many houses.

title: 1,054 Crore Lost, 1.94 Crore Recovered: Cybercrime Alert In Madhya Pradesh
content: Residents of Madhya Pradesh have lost a whopping Rs 1,054 crore to cyber frauds in the past four years, but state police have been able to recover less than 0.2 per cent

title: "Sovereign Nations Have Right...": Russia Backs India Amid US Tariff Threat
content: Russia has accused the United States of exerting illegal trade pressure on India over its oil imports from them after US President Donald Trump threatened to raise tariffs citing purchase of Russian oil.

title: BJP Member Raises Concerns Over Code 'GAY' For Gaya Airport, Centre Responds
content: A BJP member in Rajya Sabha has raised concerns about 'GAY' as the IATA identifier code for Gaya international airport in Bihar.

title: BJP's Suvendu Adhikari's Convoy Attacked In Bengal's Cooch Behar
content: Suvendu Adhikari, the Leader of the Opposition in the West Bengal assembly, was attacked while he was leading a protest rally in Cooch Behar.

title: Saudi Arabia's Tourism Shift From Skyscrapers To Mountain Villages
content: Saudi Arabia's sovereign wealth fund, called the Public Investment Fund (PIF), and private investors are working on master plans costing billions of dollars for projects that can be enjoyed year-round.

title: Adani Ports Clocks 21% Revenue Jump At Rs 9,126 Crore In First Quarter
content: Adani Ports and Special Economic Zone Limited (APSEZ) on Tuesday reported a 21 per cent jump in quarterly revenue at Rs 9,126 crore, driven by a 2 times jump in logistics and a 2.9 times increase in marine.

title: Delhi Education Minister Tables Bill To Regulate Private School Fees
content: Delhi Education Minister Ashish Sood lashed out at the previous government, saying that parents were going to court with their children over fees. The minister tabled the Delhi School Education Bill, 2025 in the Delhi Assembly.

title: UP Teacher Suspended, Charged For Showing Obscene Videos To Students
content: A schoolmaster here was accused by several female students of exposing them to explicit videos, police said on Tuesday.

title: US Wanted India To Buy Russian Oil When Ukraine War Started. What Changed
content: In a now-viral video, Garcetti can be heard admitting that it was Washington that had encouraged New Delhi to buy oil from Moscow at a price cap to stabilise global prices.

title: How Google Search Helped Missing Karnataka Woman Reunite With Family
content: A mentally ill woman, hailing from Karnataka and missing for the last one-and-a-half years, has been reunited with her family with the help of Google Search and efforts by a social organisation in Maharashtra.

title: 'India not good trading partner': Trump says will raise tariffs substantially in 24 hrs
content: US Presdient Donald Trump has declared his intention to significantly increase tariffs on India, citing country's purchase of Russian oil. He accuses India of profiting by reselling Russian oil while disregarding the conflict in Ukraine.

title: 'Trump negotiating ceasefire baseless': Ex-India cricketer takes dig at England legend
content: Former Indian cricketer Wasim Jaffer has humorously dismissed viral rumours suggesting that Donald Trump intervened to broker peace between him and Michael Vaughan. Jaffer clarified on X that the reports are baseless, confirming that the social media banter with the former England captain will continue.

title: Kerala schools plan to scrap backbenches: What this quiet reform could mean for classroom learning
content: Kerala is set to eliminate traditional backbenches in state-run schools, aiming to boost student confidence and equity. Inspired partly by the Malayalam film Sthanarthi Sreekuttan, the move challenges classroom hierarchies by promoting inclusive seating like U-shaped layouts. An expert panel will recommend alternatives as the state rethinks how physical space impacts learning outcomes and emotional wellbeing.

title: Angry at Mira Murati for refusing Meta's $1 Bn job offer; CEO Zuckerberg launched...
content: Meta's CEO, Mark Zuckerberg, reportedly attempted to acquire Mira Murati's startup, Thinking Machines Lab, with a $1 billion offer. After Murati declined, Zuckerberg allegedly launched a recruitment drive targeting its employees, including Andrew Tulloch, offering a potential $1.5 billion pay package.

title: Voter list lapse: ECI suspends 4 Bengal officers over fake entries
content: The Election Commission of India took action against officials in West Bengal. Four officials got suspended for sharing elector roll database credentials. They shared it with unauthorized people. The action followed reports of wrongful additions to electoral rolls in Baruipur Purba. Disciplinary proceedings and FIRs are expected. This is due to potential criminal misconduct.

title: 15-year-old girl out for snacks shot dead in market by ‘boyfriend’
content: In a tragic incident in Delhi's Jahangirpuri, a 15-year-old girl was fatally shot by her 20-year-old boyfriend in a crowded market area. The accused, who is currently absconding, allegedly fired multiple rounds at the girl in front of a clinic, leading to her death.

title: Why the Delhi School Education Bill is facing sharp criticism: A closer look at the 15% clause
content: The Delhi School Education Fee Regulation Bill, 2025, proposes a three-tier oversight system to regulate private school fee hikes. Though billed as a transparency measure, it faces criticism over a clause allowing up to 15% annual fee hikes without external approval. Parents’ groups argue the provision empowers school managements disproportionately, risking further commercialisation in education.

title: Why Taiwan government has arrested three employees of the world's biggest chipmaker
content: Taiwan's TSMC, the world's leading chipmaker, has detained three current and former employees for allegedly stealing trade secrets related to its advanced 2-nanometer chip technology. The breach, discovered through internal monitoring, led to legal proceedings under Taiwan's amended National Security Act. This law, enacted to protect critical technologies, carries penalties of up to 12 years in prison and hefty fines.

title: Massive cloudburst in Uttarakhand: Entire village swept away; 4 dead, several missing
content: A cloudburst-triggered flash flood in Uttarkashi's Dharali village caused widespread devastation, sweeping away homes, shops, and roads. Rescue teams, including SDRF and Army personnel, are on-site conducting relief operations amid fears that laborers may be trapped. The Meteorological Department has issued warnings for continued heavy rainfall across Uttarakhand, particularly in hilly areas, until August 10.

title: Tougher checks for marriage-based Green Cards: US issues guidelines
content: USCIS has updated its policy manual to combat marriage fraud in family-based immigration, prompted by concerns over fraudulent applications and national security risks. The updated policy mandates comprehensive evidence of bona fide marriages and rigorous interviews. Individuals convicted of marriage fraud face imprisonment, fines, and deportation, reflecting stricter scrutiny and vetting procedures.

title: 'Right to choose': Russia backs India, rebukes Trump's tariff threat over crude oil
content: The Kremlin has defended India's right to choose its trading partners, criticizing Trump's threat to raise tariffs over Russian oil imports. India has rebuffed Trump's warning as "unjustified," asserting its oil purchases are driven by market conditions. India vowed to protect its interests, noting that the US and EU also trade with Russia.

title: GitHub CEO to software engineers: Either you ..., or get out of your career
content: GitHub CEO Thomas Dohmke warns software engineers to embrace AI or risk career obsolescence, emphasizing AI's central role in coding. He envisions developers evolving into AI strategists, focusing on higher-level problem-solving and AI-driven solutions. The future anticipates AI writing 90% of code, urging engineers to reinvent their roles as code enablers and embrace human-AI collaboration.

title: Meet space hurricanes: Polar plasma storms disrupt GPS; pose stealth threat to satellite
content: Space hurricanes, unlike typical geomagnetic disturbances, are stealthy threats to satellite systems, forming even when the sun is quiet. These swirling plasma vortices disrupt GPS accuracy, scramble satellite signals, and distort Earth’s magnetic field without warning. Their ability to bypass normal forecasting models makes them a hidden threat to global navigation and communication infrastructure, especially in remote polar regions.

title: Hulk Hogan & Brooke: Tearful final call before death — begged for forgiveness, reports say
content: Just days before his death at 71 from cardiac arrest, WWE icon Hulk Hogan reportedly reconciled with his estranged daughter, Brooke. A tearful conversation led to forgiveness, with both expressing their love and regrets. Despite this reconciliation, Brooke was reportedly not planning to attend her father's funeral. Hogan was also battling chronic lymphocytic leukemia.

title: Man films lion devouring prey; predator turns and charges at him – watch video
content: A viral video captured a man's reckless encounter with a lion as he approached the animal devouring its prey to film it. The lion, sensing the intrusion, reacted aggressively, briefly pushing the man. The incident sparked outrage online, with many criticizing the man's dangerous stunt and highlighting the potential consequences for both human and animal safety.

title: Travis Kelce’s ‘dealbreaker’ resurfaces: clip stirs Taylor Swift buzz — fans spot red flag
content: A video of Kansas City Chiefs' Travis Kelce from 2016 resurfaced. Before Taylor Swift, Kelce revealed his dating preferences. He appeared on 'Watch What Happens Live' and shared his views on relationships. Kelce said that being selfie-obsessed was a dealbreaker for him. The clip went viral as Kelce enjoys superstardom. His old remarks are now headline news.

title: US announces new visa rules! Business travellers may have to pay $15,000 in bonds soon
content: The Donald Trump administration is reviving a policy requiring visitors from countries with high visa overstay rates to pay bonds up to $15,000 for B-1 and B-2 visas. This year-long pilot program aims to ensure visitors depart on time.

title: IND vs ENG: 'Dominate' - Gautam Gambhir's bold message to Team India after victory in The Oval
content: Gautam Gambhir's leadership and Shubman Gill's captaincy inspired India to a thrilling six-run victory at The Oval, drawing the Test series 2-2. Mohammed Siraj's five-wicket haul secured the win, India's narrowest ever in Test history. This triumph boosted India to third in the ICC World Test Championship standings, highlighting the team's evolving identity and promising future.

title: Father-in-law tips off cops about booze party in Surat hotel; all arrested
content: Surat police raided a hotel party at 'Weekend Address' following a tip about liquor consumption, arresting six individuals, including two female artists and four businessmen. The raid, triggered by a family dispute where a man reported his daughter-in-law's presence, led to the seizure of liquor and glasses.

title: Parliament extends President's Rule in Manipur by 6 months
content: Rajya Sabha approved extending President's Rule in Manipur for six more months due to ongoing unrest. Union minister Nityanand Rai moved the resolution, previously passed by Lok Sabha. This decision follows N Biren Singh's resignation as chief minister amidst violence between Meitei and Kuki-Zomi communities, displacing thousands.

title: To dodge Rs 6k bill, youths fake bone in veg biryani at Gorakhpur restaurant
content: In Gorakhpur, a group of young men tried to avoid paying their restaurant bill. They falsely claimed a bone was in their vegetarian biryani. The restaurant staff checked the CCTV footage. The footage revealed the youths planting the bone themselves. Police arrived to maintain order. No formal complaint has been filed by either party in this incident at Biryani Bae.

title: DU CSAS round 3 seat allocation results released: Check direct link to download list here
content: Delhi University has announced the Round 3 seat allocation for undergraduate admissions on August 5, 2025. Students can check their allotment status on admission.uod.ac.in. Those who want to apply through the Mid-Entry window can do so from August 8 to August 10. The final seat allotment list, including special categories, will be released on August 13.

title: CBSE Class 10 Supplementary Result 2025 released: Check marksheet
content: The CBSE declared the Class 10 Supplementary Exam Result 2025 on August 5, accessible on official websites and platforms like DigiLocker. Out of 1,38,898 students, 67,620 passed, resulting in an overall pass percentage of 48.68%. The board has announced the schedule for verification of marks, scanned copies of answer sheets, and re-evaluation, with online applications available soon.

title: 25 baby cobras in 15 days: MP school shuts classrooms; digs floors to end snake scare
content: A government girls' school in Madhya Pradesh is grappling with a cobra infestation, as 25 baby cobras have been found in the last two weeks. The alarming situation has forced the school to close classrooms, disrupting lessons for over 1000 students. Authorities are working to seal potential snake nests and ensure the safety of everyone.

title: 'Poora khol ... ': Owaisi's explosive comment on Mohammed Siraj
content: India secured a thrilling six-run victory against England in the final Test at The Oval, drawing the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy series 2-2. Mohammed Siraj's outstanding five-wicket haul in the second innings was pivotal, earning him Player of the Match. Shubman Gill, stepping in as captain, also shone, receiving the Player of the Series award for his exceptional performance.

title: 'She’s human too': Christian Coleman defends girlfriend Sha’Carri Richardson
content: Sha’Carri Richardson's arrest at Seattle airport after a dispute with Christian Coleman sparked headlines, but Coleman's empathetic response shifted the focus. He downplayed the incident, emphasizing Richardson's struggles and his decision not to press charges.

title: Moon reactor by 2030: Nasa’s 100-kilowatt power plan; China-Russia lunar race heats up
content: The US aims to build a nuclear reactor on the Moon by 2030. Sean Duffy leads this project for lunar energy independence. This plan counters China and Russia's lunar base. The reactor will power habitats and resource extraction. NASA also plans to replace the International Space Station. Contracts will be awarded to private companies.

title: 'Carried India without Virat, Rohit': Ex-Pak cricketer's remark on Shubman
content: Danish Kaneria lauded India's Test series performance against England, praising Shubman Gill's leadership in the absence of senior players. Gill's remarkable 754 runs and Mohammed Siraj's bowling prowess were pivotal. Akash Deep's crucial 66 and Jaiswal's century significantly contributed to India's thrilling victory, securing a 2-2 series draw.

title: 'This day that year': Amid Trump tariff heat, Army recalls 1971 war; news clip shows how US helped Pak
content: India-US relations face strain over Russian oil imports. The Indian Army recalls US support for Pakistan in 1971. Donald Trump criticizes India's oil trade, threatening higher tariffs. India defends its energy policy, citing national interest. The Ministry of External Affairs calls US and EU stance unjustified. New Delhi points to Western nations' continued trade with Russia.

title: IND vs ENG: 'Oh, piss off' - Broad doesn't hold back when asked to pick between Gill and Root
content: India defeated England by six runs at The Oval, drawing the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy. Former players reacted, including Stuart Broad who humorously picked Joe Root over Shubman Gill for a combined XI. Mohammed Siraj's five-wicket haul secured the win. This victory moved India to third place in the ICC World Test Championship standings.

title: 'Uno reverse': Man beats elderly dog with stick, gets thrashed by locals in Navi Mumbai; video
content: A shocking incident in Navi Mumbai's Kopar Khairane area saw a 16-year-old stray dog brutally assaulted with a wooden plank, sparking outrage after a video went viral. Animal rescuers swiftly intervened, saving the injured dog and confronting the accused, whose mother allegedly instigated the attack.

title: Pamela Anderson says there is no feud with Meghan Markle over cooking shows
content: Pamela Anderson dismisses claims that Meghan Markle's cooking show, 'With Love, Meghan,' copies her own, 'Pamela's Cooking With Love.' Anderson rated the similarity a 'one' on Andy Cohen's show, stating she didn't invent cooking shows. While some online users noted similar garden scenes and camera angles, Anderson remains unconcerned.

title: Several homes, hotels washed away: Cloudburst triggers flash floods in Uttarkashi - Details
content: A devastating cloudburst in Uttarakhand's Uttarkashi district triggered severe flash floods, washing away homes and hotels in Dharali village. Approximately 10-12 people are feared trapped, with rescue operations underway by the Army, SDRF, and NDRF. Chief Minister Pushkar Singh Dhami is closely monitoring the situation, ensuring all possible assistance is provided to the affected region.

title: Former J&K governor Satyapal Malik passes away at 79
content: Satya Pal Malik, the former Governor of Jammu and Kashmir, passed away at 79 in New Delhi due to complications from a urinary tract infection and kidney failure. He served as the last Governor of J&K during the abrogation of Article 370 in August 2019.

title: Trump's tariff jibes: India calls out US, EU hypocrisy – 10-point reply
content: India has strongly responded to US President Trump's tariff threats, highlighting the hypocrisy of Western nations continuing trade with Russia while criticizing India's oil imports. India defends its energy procurement as vital for national interest and points out the significantly larger trade volumes between Europe and Russia.

title: IND vs ENG: What is Mohammed Siraj’s nickname? Broad reveals
content: Former England pacer Stuart Broad lauded Mohammed Siraj's skill and spirit after his impressive performance in the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy. Siraj, the leading wicket-taker with 22 wickets, earned the nickname 'Mr. Angry' from England players for his relentless passion. Broad highlighted Siraj's strategic bowling, dismissing key batsmen and securing India's series-drawing victory.

title: Watch: Bengal LoP Suvendu Adhikari's convoy attacked; vehicle damaged
content: Suvendu Adhikari, West Bengal's leader of the opposition, faced an alleged attack on his convoy in Cooch Behar. He was traveling to the Superintendent of Police's office when the incident occurred, prompting investigations into the region's law and order situation. Details regarding the attack's specifics, potential injuries, and involved parties remain unconfirmed as authorities delve into the matter.

title: Nasa monitors 2025 OT7 asteroid: Earth flyby on August 5; size, speed, distance revealed
content: Space is an active place. Asteroid 2025 OT7 will fly by Earth in August 2025. It is about 170 feet wide. It will travel at high speed. It will pass at a safe distance. NASA and other agencies monitor such objects. ISRO is also planning asteroid missions. These events highlight the need for planetary defense.

title: Siraj's success story: Mother's daily prayers, visit to late father's grave
content: Mohammed Siraj's journey is fuelled by his father's dream and his mother's prayers. He honours his father's memory by visiting his grave before and after tours, drawing strength from his blessings. Virat Kohli's unwavering support transformed Siraj, while Cristiano Ronaldo's 'Believe' inspired him to excel, culminating in a remarkable performance in England, becoming the highest wicket-taker.

title: Kakoli Dastidar appointed chief TMC LS whip; Satabdi Roy named deputy leader
content: Following internal discord and a lack of coordination among MPs, Trinamool Congress appointed Kakoli Ghosh Dastidar as its chief whip in Lok Sabha after Kunal Ghosh's resignation. Satabdi Roy has been named the deputy leader in the Lower House. Kalyan Banerjee's resignation as chief whip stemmed from unease within the party due to public spats with fellow TMC MPs.

title: 'Men don't belong in women sports': Trump admin restricts trans athletes visas
content: The Donald Trump administration planned to update visa rules. This aimed to prevent transgender women from participating in women's sports in America. US Citizenship and Immigration Services called it a matter of safety. The policy impacted visa categories for individuals with extraordinary abilities. It also extended to national interest waivers.

title: August 5 may be shortest day ever: Earth spins faster; air pressure to blame
content: On August 5, 2025, Earth is expected to experience a slightly shorter day, approximately 1.34 milliseconds less than 24 hours. This phenomenon is attributed to changes within the Earth's core and atmospheric fluctuations. While imperceptible to humans, this acceleration could impact precise timekeeping systems like atomic clocks and GPS networks, requiring adjustments to maintain synchronization.

title: Conor McGregor invites Trump to Dublin pub: Offers “Ireland’s best coke” experience
content: Conor McGregor, amidst recent controversies and a potential presidential run, has extended an invitation to Donald Trump to visit his Black Forge Inn pub in Dublin. The former UFC double champion and known Trump supporter referenced their past White House visit from earlier this year and even shared an AI-generated image of them as knights.

title: Assam BJP leader slams Malviya over ‘Bangladeshi language’ row
content: Defending a Delhi Police communique on “translation of documents containing text in Bangladeshi language”, the BJP’s IT cell chief said Sylheti was “nearly incomprehensible to Indian Bengalis”

title: Handloom sector gets a major boost in Andhra Pradesh
content: Government decides to bear GST on handloom textiles, besides giving 200 units of power free of cost to traditional looms and 500 units to powerlooms; the decisions will come into effect from August 7, which is observed as National Handloom Day

title: 40 people freed from bonded labour in Prakasam district
content: District administration officials track the victims with the help of voluntary organisations and rescued them on Monday

title: Decoding the success of ‘Su From So’ | Raj B Shetty | JP Thuminad
content: A video essay decoding the success of the film ‘Su from So’ and how it can help Kannada cinema flourish.

title: Revenue Minister inaugurates Bhu Suraksha Yojane, project aimed at digitising all base land records
content: Krishna Byre Gowda says there are an estimated 100-crore pages of land records in the State that need to be scanned. We have completed scanning 36.35-lakh pages so far, and the remaining will be done at the earliest, he says

title: KTU decides to waive year-out system for UG programmes this year
content: Issue, which potentially affected several students under the 2019 regulations, had triggered protests recently

title: Yellow Line Metro project belongs to people, not to any political party or govt. alone: DKS
content: Deputy Chief Minister says it is a joint partnership between the State and Union governments, and the focus here is to serve the people

title: P4 is not a scheme, but a movement, says Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu
content: The initiative that blends welfare with empowerment is a mission of humanity, wherein people become partners of change, says the Chief Minister; he lauds a sanitary worker from Avanigadda for extending support to a poor, elderly woman

title: Thrissur to host State School Kalolsavam from January 7 to 11
content: Sanskrit and Arabic literary festivals too will coincide with the school arts festival to be held at 25 venues. State school sports meet will be held at Thiruvananthapuram in an Olympic style from October 22 to 27.

title: Madras University journalism department examination row: High Court orders a thorough internal inquiry
content: Justice C. Kumarappan says conduct of unauthorised examination by a Head of the Department, without prior approval from competent authorities, cannot be taken lightly

title: After 14 years, Tamil Nadu records double-digit growth in real terms
content: The State has posted 11.19% during 2024-25, according to the revised estimates of the Union Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation. It has exceeded the forecast made in the Tamil Nadu Budget, presented early this year, by nearly 2.2%

title: Protest staged outside Central University campus seeking probe into death of student
content: A 20-year-old B.Sc second year student from Odisha Jayashree Nayak was found dead in her hostel room on the university campus on July 30

title: BBMP pins hopes on climate clubs despite slow start
content: According to BCAC data, as of Tuesday, 754 clubs have been formed across educational institutions, but only 117 are actively functioning

title: ICCS develops AI-based system to predict rainfall two hours in advance
content: It will serve as a critical tool for agencies like the Disaster Management Authority, providing timely alerts on heavy rainfall and potential landslides

title: Bankers told to make adequate security arrangements
content: Anantapur SP asks bank officials to instal CCTVs at the entrance and exit points of the banks to capture people’s movements clearly

title: Ministry of Ayush releases list of Ayurvedic food preparations under category of ‘Ayurveda Aahara’
content: Ayurveda Aahara refers to food products developed in line with the dietary principles of Ayurveda; these preparations emphasise balance, seasonal suitability, and use of natural ingredients and herbs known for their therapeutic benefits

title: Survey finds 1,365 Nilgiri tahrs in Kerala
content: Population Estimation 2025, jointly done in Kerala and Tamil Nadu, has pegged the Nilgiri tahr number at 2,668

title: Lalu's son Tej Pratap announces formation of coalition of 5 minor parties to contest Bihar polls
content: The five parties are Vikas Vanchit Insaan Party, Bhojpuriya Jan Morcha, Pragatisheel Janta Party, Wajib Adhikar Party and Sanyukt Kisan Vikas Party

title: Heavy rain trigger widespread flooding across Thrissur district
content: Homes inundated; furniture, electric equipment damaged and traffic thrown into disarray; residents blame poor drainage and canal blockages

title: Andhra Pradesh Agriculture Minister Atchannaidu assures uninterrupted supply of fertilizers to farmers for kharif
content: Directing officials to monitor the supply and prevent shortages, Atchannaidu terms YSRCP’s allegations as false

title: Sponsor claims Argentinian Football Association has not yet officially called off Kerala tour
content: Tour to Kerala planned during October-November window this year. In the event AFA violates contract to that effect then it will amount to cheating, which will be dealt with legally, says Anto Augustine, managing director of broadcasting company that claims to be sponsor of the tour

title: Chittoor district administration geared up for Kanipakam Brahmotsavams
content: The annual event will be held from August 27 to September 16; Vinayaka Chavithi, Radhotsavam, Pushpa Pallaki, and Teppotsavam will attract huge devotee rush, says Collector

title: Priyank Kharge, Sharan Prakash Patil accused of ignoring demands of Ediga community
content: They expressed solidarity with us during the hunger strike in 2022 but now have turned a deaf ear to our demands: Pranavananda Swami

title: ‘RERA can grade real estate promoters to increase credibility’
content: RERA can spread its wings and take on a larger role like enforcing green building norms or safety audits, said Sanjay Chugh, city head and director, ANAROCK Property Consultants Pvt. Ltd., Chennai.

title: SREE’s free training helps 14 crack constable exam
content: As many as 42 candidates who could not afford coaching and physical training were chosen by SREE foundation and provided free coaching facilities.

title: Jagan urges lawyers to defend ‘victims of political harassment’
content: Recalling schemes extended to the fraternity during his term, the YSRCP chief exhorts members of the party Legal Cell to rise against ‘political misuse of power’

title: VOC Port handles 15 million tonnes of cargo this fiscal
content: The port’s primary hinterland has been witnessing rapid industrialisation which helped in achieve the milestone 11 days ahead compared to the previous financial year

title: Lok Sabha passes Bill to provide reservation to STs in Goa Assembly
content: This is the first Bill to be passed by the Lok Sabha in the ongoing Monsoon session which has seen disruptions by the Opposition on various issues

title: Take Operation Sindoor like action to safeguard dignity of women in digital space, Madras High Court tells Centre
content: Justice N. Anand Venkatesh says, the dignity of every woman in the country must be considered as important as the dignity of the whole nation put together

title: Lahar Singh alleges organised campaign by Congress against constitutional bodies like ECI and SC
content: In a social media post, Mr. Singh says, “It is unfortunate that Mr. Hariprasad has cast aspersions on the Supreme Court of India after it warned Mr. Rahul Gandhi for his remarks on the Indian army, on Monday.”

title: Here are the big stories from Karnataka today
content: Welcome to the Karnataka Today newsletter, your guide from The Hindu on the major news stories to follow today. Curated and written by Nalme Nachiyar.

title: Calcutta University Vice-Chancellor receives praise for defying exam rescheduling request
content: University of Calcutta stands firm on autonomy after refusing State government’s plea to postpone exams on Trinamool students’ wing foundation day

title: Three-day ‘Pavitrotsavams’ commences in Tirumala
content: Immense significance is attached to the annual event, in which the priests seek forgiveness for all the acts of omissions and commissions, committed knowingly or unknowingly, in the performance of the rituals

title: India to host WHO-IRCH workshop on herbal medicine regulation from August 6
content: Three-day event to focus on global cooperation, safety mechanisms, and regulatory convergence for traditional medicine

title: Uttarkashi cloudburst: PM Modi, Amit Shah, Rajnath speak to CM Dhami; assure Centre’s assistance
content: The cloudburst took place in the catchment area of the Kheer Ganga river, leading to the devastating floods, locals said

title: L. Murugan urges T.N. government to release White Paper on investments attracted in last four years
content: According to Mr. Murugan, Chief Minister M.K. Stalin’s foreign trips to attract investments have not yielded positive results.

title: Satheesan urges State Election Commission to extend deadline for inclusion of names in voters’ list
content: Online processes such as adding new names to the list, corrections and moving a voter’s name from one ward to another have witnessed continuous disruption in many places due to technical issues

title: India has abiding interest in peace in South China Sea, says MEA
content: MEA Secretary (East) P Kumaran said India has an "abiding interest" in peace and stability in the region

title: Today’s home buyers need not even have to visit the property: Casagrand Chairman
content: Gone are those days where many staff were employed by realtors to handle customer calls and enquiries

title: A.P. government has allocated ₹125 crore to provide free power to handloom weavers: Minister
content: Minister for Energy Gottipati Ravi Kumar announced that the initiative to empower the weavers will officially commence on Weavers’ Day, August 7

title: Here comes the Judge! AL MVP favorite returns
content: fantasy baseball buzz file aims to provide fantasy managers with the intel they need as news breaks around baseball . everything else will be played under clear conditions or in a dome . the new york Yankees will activate Aaron Judge from the 10-day IL in advance of tonight's road tilt with the Texas Rangers .

title: Black rain alert twice in 6 hrs: Hong Kong flights delayed, public services hit
content: seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sift through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock . we strive to keep you informed about the ever-evolving world, delivering a nuanced understanding of international affairs to our readers .

title: Benson, Higgins headline 'have skills, need opportunity' team
content: the Cincinnati Bengals running back is one of the best examples in recent memory . he was a 12th-round pick and the 34th running back off the board last season . his explosive ability quickly earned him the lion's share of the rushing chores .

title: Catching up on the Big 12: Power Rankings, key players, must-see games
content: the big 12 title looks to be available to nearly any team in the conference . this year, Texas Tech, fresh off a massive push to bring in new talent in the offseason, will look to join the conference's elite . we're here to get you caught up on the Big 12 by breaking down the CFP outlook .

title: Bo Nix keeps passing every test
content: the book "American Kings: a Biography of the Quarterback" will be available on sept. 9 . a year earlier, a Broncos scout had given him an analysis of a particular quarterback . the quarterback would need everyone in the building supporting him to succeed .

title: Biggest concern, what's left to play for and more: Post-trade-deadline guide for all 30 MLB teams
content: the 2025 trade deadline featured 92 veteran trade candidates on new teams . 92 prospects headed to new organizations seeking their big league opportunity . this is what we do with every edition of Stock Watch . there is never as much mystery in the outcomes as there is after a heavy period of roster movement .

title: What would Cowboys' pass rush look like without Micah Parsons?
content: Jerry Jones says he won't trade Micah Parsons . the Cowboys reset the franchise by trading their best player, Herschel Walker, to the Minnesota Vikings . parsons has 52.5 sacks in his first four seasons .

title: 'This is truly a startup': How the 'new' Pac-12 is taking shape
content: the Pac-12 has existed in various states of transition . the future is beginning to take shape . it's a new and different league, and not the old Pac-12 . "we essentially get to start over with a blank slate," says commissioner .

title: Training camp battles to watch for all 32 teams
content: players are battling for positions on the depth chart at training camps across the NFL . coaches are seeking clarity on who starts and who will provide backup . the los Angeles Rams are looking to secure their third receiving option behind Davante Adams and Puka Nacua .
